DOC.brief_summary: RATIONALE : Chemoprevention use certain drug supplement keep cancer forming , grow , come back . The use omega-3 fatty acid may prevent breast cancer . PURPOSE : This randomized clinical trial study well omega-3 fatty acid work prevent breast cancer woman high risk develop breast cancer .
DOC.brief_title: Omega-3 Fatty Acids Preventing Breast Cancer Women High Risk Developing Breast Cancer
DOC.detailed_description: OBJECTIVES : Primary - Determine effect omega-3 fatty acid mammographic breast density ( MBD ) woman high risk develop breast cancer . Secondary - Determine , preliminarily , effect supplement cell atypia breast cell proliferation measure ductal lavage specimens patient . - Determine effect supplement circulate hormone growth factor blood level patient . - Determine effect supplement expression estrogen-related protein find ductal lavage specimens patient . - Determine effect supplement plasma lipid peroxidation level patient . - Correlate modifying effect lipid peroxidation-related gene MBD patient treat supplement . OUTLINE : This randomize , pilot study . Patients randomize 1 2 treatment arm . - Arm I : Patients receive oral placebo three time daily 12 month . - Arm II : Patients receive oral omega-3 fatty acid three time daily 12 month . In arm , treatment continue absence development ductal carcinoma situ invasive carcinoma breast unacceptable toxicity . PROJECTED ACCRUAL : A total 80 patient ( 40 per treatment arm ) accrue study .
DOC.criteria: DISEASE CHARACTERISTICS : At increase risk develop breast cancer , define 1 follow criterion : 5year Gail risk ≥ 1.7 % Calculated 5year Gail risk ≥ 5 time average age group , define 1 following : At least 0.1 % ( patient age 2029 ) At least 1.0 % ( patient age 3039 ) At least 1.7 % ( patient age 40 ) Known BRCA1 BRCA2 mutation carrier Family history consistent hereditary breast cancer , define following : At least 4 relative diagnose breast cancer age At least 2 firstdegree relative diagnose breast cancer age 50 young Breast ovarian cancer diagnose relative At least 2 occurrence breast cancer 1 occurrence ovarian cancer age family Atypical hyperplasia lobular carcinoma situ breast prior biopsy History unilateral ductal carcinoma situ breast History invasive stage I breast cancer remission ( complete local systemic standard therapy ) History ovarian cancer remission > 5 year Baseline mammogram perform within past 6 month interpretation suspicious malignancy ( BIRAD 13 ) Not eligible OR refuse standard breast cancer risk reduction strategy ( e.g. , prophylactic oophorectomy , prophylactic mastectomy , tamoxifen ) PATIENT CHARACTERISTICS : Age 18 Sex Female Menopausal status Not specify Performance status SWOG 01 Life expectancy Not specify Hematopoietic Absolute granulocyte count ≥ 1,500/mm^3 Platelet count ≥ 100,000/mm^3 Hemoglobin ≥ 8.0 g/dL Hepatic SGOT and/or SGPT ≤ 2.5 time upper limit normal ( ULN ) Alkaline phosphatase ≤ 2.5 time ULN Bilirubin ≤ 2.0 time ULN Renal Creatinine ≤ 2.0 mg/dL Other Not pregnant nursing Negative pregnancy test No underlying medical , psychiatric , social condition would preclude study participation No invasive malignancy within past 5 year except nonmelanoma skin cancer PRIOR CONCURRENT THERAPY : Biologic therapy Not specify Chemotherapy Not specify Endocrine therapy More 6 month since prior concurrent hormonal therapy , include follow : Antiestrogens Estrogen Selective estrogenreceptor modulators Progestins Aromatase inhibitor Hormonal contraceptive Radiotherapy Not specify Surgery No prior bilateral mastectomy Other More 3 month since prior concurrent chronic ( i.e. , > 3 time per week ) nonsteroidal antiinflammatory drug ( e.g. , aspirin , ibuprofen , indomethacin ) cyclooxygenase2 inhibitor No prior cancer treatment would preclude study treatment
